body.name: Proraso Protective Shaving Cream
deliveryMessages: FREE delivery Wednesday, February 21 on orders shipped by Amazon over $35. Order within 18 hrs 32 mins
body.description: Proraso Shaving Cream, Protective and Moisturizing Proraso Shaving Cream, Protective and Moisturizing formula, comforts your skin with extra-soothing and softening ingredients. The Vitamin E protects and nourishes dry, rough skin while the aloe vera provides extra hydration that softens and soothes. The traditional vegetable stearin-based formula is enriched with nourishing botanical extracts and natural oils to protect the skin before, during and after shaving, and helps the blade glide smoothly, reducing razor burn and rashes. Proraso Shaving Cream is still made today in accordance with a rigorous 'hot soap'-making process, which results in an ultra-rich soap that, especially with the aid of a brush, produces an incomparably thick, creamy, soft lather. It makes for a close and comfortable shave, while protecting the skin and leaving it soft and hydrated. How to use: Soak your Proraso brush in a bowl or cup filled with hot water for 5 – 10 minutes before your shave. Apply a warm, damp towel to your face (or splash face with warm water) to open the pores and prep your face for shaving. Once done, apply your favorite Proraso Pre-Shave Cream. Apply another hot towel, holding it to your face for 15 to 20 seconds. After the brush has soaked, gently squeeze out excess water, still leaving the brush mostly wet. Squeeze about 2cm of your choice of Proraso Shave Cream between the bristles of the brush and massage into your stubble or scruff using circular motion. Dip the tip of your brush back into your hot water and continue working the brush into your facial hair. After a couple minutes of 'working' the brush in your facial hair, the shaving cream turns into a creamy and compact lather that will soften all beard types, making shaving a pleasant daily ritual. Shave and rinse face thoroughly. For an optimal experience, finish with another application of your warm, damp towel, followed by your favorite Proraso After Shave Balm or Lotion Barber's choice since 1948 No parabens, no silicones No mineral oil, no SLS No artificial colors No ingredients of animal origin Over 95% natural Made in Italy

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: The Proraso Brand Story: Founded in 1908 by Ludovico Martelli, Proraso has been innovating professional highest-quality products in the shaving world for generations, and has evolved to become a staple of Italian culture. From the first Pre-Shave cream in 1948, to now, the Martelli family principles hold true: to create professional, quality products that deliver a pleasurable and impeccable shave, in the barbershop and at home. Proraso Shaving Cream, Protective and Moisturizing Proraso Shaving Cream, Protective and Moisturizing formula, comforts your skin with extra-soothing and softening ingredients. The Vitamin E protects and nourishes dry, rough skin while the aloe vera provides extra hydration that softens and soothes. The traditional vegetable stearin-based formula is enriched with nourishing botanical extracts and natural oils to protect the skin before, during and after shaving, and helps the blade glide smoothly, reducing razor burn and rashes. Proraso Shaving Cream is still made today in accordance with a rigorous 'hot soap'-making process, which results in an ultra-rich soap that, especially with the aid of a brush, produces an incomparably thick, creamy, soft lather. It makes for a close and comfortable shave, while protecting the skin and leaving it soft and hydrated. How to use: Soak your Proraso brush in a bowl or cup filled with hot water for 5 – 10 minutes before your shave. Apply a warm, damp towel to your face (or splash face with warm water) to open the pores and prep your face for shaving. Once done, apply your favorite Proraso Pre-Shave Cream. Apply another hot towel, holding it to your face for 15 to 20 seconds. After the brush has soaked, gently squeeze out excess water, still leaving the brush mostly wet. Squeeze about 2cm of your choice of Proraso Shave Cream between the bristles of the brush and massage into your stubble or scruff using circular motion. Dip the tip of your brush back into your hot water and continue working the brush into your facial hair. After a couple minutes of 'working' the brush in your facial hair, the shaving cream turns into a creamy and compact lather that will soften all beard types, making shaving a pleasant daily ritual. Shave and rinse face thoroughly. For an optimal experience, finish with another application of your warm, damp towel, followed by your favorite Proraso After Shave Balm or Lotion Barber's choice since 1948 No parabens, no silicones No mineral oil, no SLS No artificial colors No ingredients of animal origin Over 95% natural Made in Italy

For the ultimate shave experience, see the 10 Tips for the Perfect Shave below Short on time? Apply your favorite Proraso Pre-Shave Cream to your damp face, for optimal results. If using a shaving brush, run it under hot running water for about 30 seconds (if you don't have time to soak it). Squeeze about 2 centimeter of the Shaving Cream onto your brush, dampen face with warm water, and work the brush into your scruff/stubble. You should be able to achieve an excellent lather in about a minute. If using your hands, work cream and water together between the palm of your hands until suds begin to form. Apply mixture into your stubble using your fingers, massaging in circular movements until a lather forms. This method also works well if you’re shaving in the shower. Shave and rinse, following with your favorite Proraso After Shave Balm or Lotion.

10 Tips for the Perfect Shave Morning is the best time to shave Your skin is at it's softest and most relaxed just after you wake up, so the razor glides easier. Always use a Proraso Pre-Shave Cream It softens and straightens the hairs, making it easier to apply the shaving cream to your beard and pre-conditions the skin. Wrap your face in a warm, wet towel Just like traditional barbers do. Otherwise, shave after your morning shower when the skin is soft and hydrated from the warm water. The best lather comes from a brush and shaving cream or soap Applying shaving cream or soap with a brush increases the volume of your beard hair and allows for a closer shave. To build up a rich lather, wet your shaving brush and apply the cream in fast, repeated circular motions to coat the brush bristles well.

While shaving, use a delicate, but firm stroke Don't put too much pressure on the razor and follow the lines of your face, always keeping the skin pulled tight. Keep your razor clean Rinse the blade with hot water at least once every two swipes of the razor. Residue from past shaves can reduce the blades' effectiveness and increase the risk of damaging your skin. Also, remember to change your razor often. For the perfect shave, one pass just doesn't cut it Lather your face a second time and repeat the shave. Don't neglect your post-shave routine Rinse your face well and repeatedly to remove any residue.

Always use Proraso After Shave Balm Even if you've shaved to perfection, your skin may still feel stressed and will need to be disinfected, restored and softened Take care of your skin Especially if you don't shave every day, or have problems with ingrown hair, apply a face cream daily. Have a question? Which Proraso formula is best for me? What's the trick to making the best lather? Post your question in the Customer Questions section down below and one of our pros will answer!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 27, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars As good as any Proraso shaving cream
reviews.reviewText: Foams up real well with a good badger brush. Scent isn't really my bag - kind of like your corporate boss' cologne. Of course, after you get out of the shower it's not going to stick with you anyway.I personally like the Proraso shaving cream specifically for sensitive skin the best - that's just me. I like many of the others for their scents, such as the Sandalwood, but I always go back to the sensitive skin shaving cream.Did it moisturize any better? I can't tell. But it's as solid shaving cream as any other I've used.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 22, 2023
reviews.reviewText: Have to shave 5 days a week at least and it keeps my skin smooth. Lather is great and it only takes a tiny amount for a full shave. One tube lasts months!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 9, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Perfect for use with Safety razor
reviews.reviewText: Used to use shave soap with my safety razor. This cream is so much better. Lasts forever. Smells amazing and is great on your skin.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 11, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Terrific Shave Cream, Terrible Amazon Packaging For Shipping
reviews.reviewText: Proraso is a great value, and I've been enjoying their shave cream for years. Although I like all the varieties and find they perform great, the scent of Proraso blue and the sandalwood (red) are my favorites. There's a minor annoyance buying from Amazon however: This time, the thin cardboard box arrived crushed, and the tube of cream inside was badly dented. Since it wasn't punctured, and won't prevent dispensing all the product, I won't be returning it. But especially since it's happened with previous purchases, and is a common problem reported in reviews, Amazon should stop shipping easily crushed items (like non-rigid boxes) in envelopes, even padded ones.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 1, 2020
reviews.reviewText: I went back to wet shaving (from a Braun electric razor) early this year. After 30 years of shaving almost every day with the electric, I retired and now only shave 2-3 times a week. Electric just didn't work for that. After a few months with seveal different multiblade razors, I wasn't satisfied. In July, a started using a DE razor. For reference I use a Viking with the slightly longer handle. After a few weeks of shaving, getting my technique down and testing several popular blades, I have settled on, and regularly use Feather blades. I have used the standard Proraso tube, as well as this one, Cremo, and Taylor of Old Bond Steet St. James collection in a tub. I have come to prefer the Taylor.I still give this 5 stars overall. If there were 1/2 stars, I might take 1/2 off, but only COMPARATIVELY to the Taylor (maybe fairer to say Taylor would get a 5+). This creme has a very nice fresh smell and is supposed to be easier on the skin. I am not sure I see any difference from the regular Proraso Cream. It lathers well with a brush and lubricates reasonbly well. But the lather doesn't last well. I find that by the time I finish one side of my face the remaining lather nas thinned out and dried some and I have to constantly re-lather. But that is not a huge deal. The TOB lather lasts much longer, and lubricates better in my opinion. For tube cream users I wouldn't hesitate to recommend this. I really like the Proraso products and use their aftershave and a couple of their colognes regularly now.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 24, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Best shaving product on the market!
reviews.reviewText: I’ve used this product for over 25 years and I would never use anything else on my face. Just a Small amount is all you need and it lubricates like a professional. I use it in the shower to get the best and smoothest shave 🪒 Can be used for underarms, chest or other sensitive areas without a nick.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 17, 2014
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars WINNING! - greatly reduces irritation, gives a closer shave, and is a great moisturizer
reviews.reviewText: WINNING!Razor burn sucks! Short of perhaps getting eaten by a shark that walks on land and breathes air or gouging one's eyes out with a dull plastic spork, it is without question the worst thing in the history of time that can happen to a man.While we often think about how the razor and aftershave affects razor burn, we sometimes do not consider the middle part...the cream/gel/foam. This intermediate can play a big role...it can lubricate the razor (or increases resistance), moisturize the skin (or dry it out), open up pores (or clog them), increase the cutting efficiency of the razor (or negatively impact it), etc.Proraso is probably best known for their aftershaves, which are fantastic. However, this Shaving Cream is something you certainly do not want to pass up on either. Their Shaving Cream is just as much a moisturizer as it is a shaving cream, which may be why this stuff works so well. Obviously, shaving itself drys out skin, and dry skin=irritation. This shaving cream contains some serious ingredients to keep the skin from drying out, and when you finish up and rinse the area off, you do not get that uncool radiating feeling of irritation that you may with other products. It also contains something that keeps the razor well-lubricated, and helps stop it from shaving "too low" to a point where severe razor burns follows...but at the same time, it gives a super close shave regardless of what kind of razor you use.So, if our discussions about shaving generally include the topics of:--Getting the closest shave possible,--Reducing/preventing as much irritation (razor burn) as possible, and--Moisturizing skin to prevent irritation that comes from dry skin,then using a good razor, this Shave Cream, and following it up with Proraso aftershave lotion will leave you amazed how well the above goals can be accomplished.I agree with those who say you can use your hands to work the lather (I generally do), but also agree it works better with a brush.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on March 19, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Smooth comfortable shave
reviews.reviewText: I have been shaving for over 50 years using every blade, cream and electric razor imaginable trying to get a shave that does not butcher or irritate my face. Pretreatments, after save products even Neosporin did not satisfy. I decided to try Proraso after reading all the product reviews. Why did I not try this years ago! What a wonderful product. My shaving has turned into a pleasure instead of a fiasco. Just a little on my brush, and using a bowl, allows me to do the job. The tube will last for months and my face doesn't. look like I've beenin a dog fight. I will reorder when needed and will try the aftershave lotion. Your reviews are correct.

reviews.reviewTitle: Italian grooming product that’s worth it.
reviews.reviewText: A mild and clean scent. Less is more because the ingredients facilitates a close shave without any irritation. No razor bumps or redness whatsoever and keeps the skin moisturized and hydrated.
The packing and the tube was completely damaged and there was no seal also
Great for when you're new to brush shaving
Lathers up great, gives a comfortable shave and lasts a long time. I've used others over the years but this is the best value and gives a great shave.

I've always loved Proraso but the blue is above and beyond, that was the smoothest shave I've ever had. As to those complaining about the sent being to subtle.....it's perfect, if you wanna reek go buy some Axe body spay, this is proper shaving cream for grown-ups.
